meanings.definition: Cause great and continual trouble or distress to.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors were bedeviling the old man with their loud music every night.
meanings.sent2: The constant rain bedeviling the farmers' efforts to harvest their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel bedeviling the gardener by stealing all the nuts.
meanings.sent4: The ghostly whispers bedeviling her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The relentless mosquitoes bedeviling the campers during their trip.

meanings.sent1: The bullies were bedeviling the new student in school.
meanings.sent2: The persistent telemarketers bedeviling her with endless phone calls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten bedeviling the dog by constantly pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories bedeviling him after the accident.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending deadlines bedeviling the stressed-out employees at work.
